intro: Veronica dichrus, commonly known as the silverleaf speedwell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Veronica dichrus is also valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
